references.paper_title: Gradient Flows: In Metric Spaces and in the Space of Probability Measures
references.reason: This paper provides the foundational theory of gradient flows in metric spaces, which is crucial for understanding the dynamic formulation of optimal transport used in the current work.

references.paper_title: A computational fluid mechanics solution to the Monge-Kantorovich mass transfer problem
references.reason: This paper introduces the Benamou-Brenier theorem, which provides a dynamic formulation of optimal transport, a key concept generalized and extended in the current work.

references.paper_title: Conditional sampling with monotone GANs: from generative models to likelihood-free inference
references.reason: This paper introduces the use of triangular mappings in conditional optimal transport, which serves as a basis for the methodology developed in the current work.

references.paper_title: Normalizing flows for probabilistic modeling and inference
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of normalizing flows, which are used as a building block for the simulation-free approach in the current work.

references.paper_title: Conditional optimal transport on function spaces
references.reason: This paper extends the theory of conditional optimal transport to function spaces, which directly addresses the infinite-dimensional setting of Bayesian inverse problems considered in the current research.
